introduction: While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:
text:
• NASA’s Kepler Space Telescope was launched in 2009.
• Its primary mission was to find Earth-like planets in the habitable zones of distant stars.
• Kepler discovered thousands of exoplanets.
• Data from Kepler has radically changed our understanding of planetary systems beyond our own.
• Many exoplanets detected are similar in size to Earth.
question: The student wants to emphasize Kepler’s impact on our understanding of distant planetary systems. Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to accomplish this goal?
A: The Kepler Space Telescope, launched in 2009, discovered thousands of exoplanets and significantly altered our view of planets outside our solar system.
B: NASA launched the Kepler Space Telescope to search for Earth-like planets in habitable zones around stars.
C: Kepler detected many exoplanets that are similar in size to Earth.
D: Kepler’s data collection helped scientists publish numerous articles about planets orbiting distant stars.
explanation: Choice A specifically addresses how Kepler’s large number of discoveries reshaped our understanding of planetary systems, fulfilling the goal of emphasizing Kepler’s impact.
